featured.text: They were erected in memory of a deceased chief or a high-ranking clan member.
Aboriginal carvers continue to carve totems as symbols of their cultural pride and clan kinship.
The coastal peoples have long passed on knowledge from generation to generation through oral traditions, and totem poles were the traditional way of telling the story of an individual family or clan.

definition.zh_def: 一群有共同祖先或血緣關係的人，通常生活在一起並共享相似的文化或傳統。
definition.en_def: A group of people united by actual or perceived kinship and descent, often sharing a common culture or tradition.
definition.example: The clan gathered for their annual reunion to celebrate their heritage.
